temp.fibHeap.stixar.graph.gen
Class BasicDGFactory

java.lang.Object
  temp.fibHeap.stixar.graph.gen.BasicDGFactory

public class BasicDGFactory
extends java.lang.Object

A Factory class for digraphs made up of basic nodes and basic edges.

In general one uses this factory as follows: 

   BasicDGFactory fact = new BasicDGFactory();
   Node n1 = fact.node();
   Node n2 = fact.node();
   Edge e1 = fact.edge(n1, n2);
   Edge e2 = fact.edge(n1, n2); // multiple edges allowed.
   // ...
   Digraph dg = fact.digraph();
In the example above, dg is comprised of all the edges and nodes created since the factory was instantiated.

Each instance of this factory class is capable of producing several Digraphs comprised of BasicNodes and BasicEdges. However, the generated digraphs are unrelated and the factory is reset after each digraph is generated.

BasicDGFactory

BasicDGFactory

public BasicDGFactory(int n,
                      int m)
Create a factory with room allocated for n nodes and medges.

BasicDGFactory

public BasicDGFactory(Digraph dg)
Construct a topologic copy of a digraph, packing the ids of the nodes and edges. The resulting graph is not guaranteed to share attribute information, ie it is identical to dg up to topology but corresponding nodes may have different identifiers. For attribute preserving copy, see BasicDigraph.copy(temp.fibHeap.stixar.graph.Digraph).

Generate a number of edges randomly, disallowing multiple edges and self loops.

Parameters:

Throws:

genEdges

public void genEdges(int nEdges,
                     boolean allowMultiple,
                     boolean allowSelf)
Generate a number of edges randomly, specifying whether multiple edges or self loops are allowed.

Parameters:
nEdges - the number of edges to generate.
allowMultiple - whether to allow more than one edge between a given pair of vertices.
allowSelf - whether to allow self loops.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if nEdges > |nodes| * |nodes| and allowMultiple is false.

Parameters:

genSourceAndSink

public Pair<BasicNode,BasicNode> genSourceAndSink()
Create source and sink vertices.
  • A source vertex is a vertex connected to each vertex in the graph (other than itself and the sink vertex).
  • A sink vertex is a vertex to which every vertex in the graph (other than the source and the sink) is connected.

Note this operation is different than subsequent calls to genSource() and genSink() because the source is not directly connected to the sink.

Returns:
a pair of nodes whose first element is a source for the graph and whose second element is a sinnk for the graph.

genSource

public BasicNode genSource()
Create a new source vertex.

A source vertex is a vertex connected to each vertex in the graph (other than itself and the sink vertex).

Returns:
a source vertex.

genSink

public BasicNode genSink()
Create a new sink vertex.

A sink vertex is a vertex to which every vertex in the graph (other than the source and the sink) is connected.

Returns:
a sink vertex.

public boolean containsEdge(int sid,
                            int tid)
Tell whether or not an edge exists between a source and target node.

Parameters:
sid - the identifier of the source node.
tid - the identifier of the target node.
Returns:
